original: WHEREAS, the parties desire to set forth the terms pursuant to which FCC will supply certain products to Flotek; and NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the foregoing recitals and the mutual covenants and agreements contained herein, the parties do hereby agree as follows:
ollama_generated:
WHEREAS, the parties seek to establish the terms under which Flotek will procure specific goods from FCC; AND HENCEFORTH, in consideration of the aforementioned premises and the reciprocal promises and commitments within this document, the parties shall mutually consent as follows:

This rephrased clause inverts the condition, making Flotek the supplier and FCC the buyer. It also slightly weakens the obligation by using "procure" instead of "supply", implying that Flotek may source goods from other suppliers if necessary.

original: “Affiliate ” means any party controlled by, controlling under common control with, the party to whom the reference is made.
modified: "Affiliate" shall be deemed as any entity not solely controlled by, but having significant influence or control over, the party being referenced, or entities that are themselves under the substantial control of such party. This definition encompasses both direct and indirect relationships.

original: 3.Term . The “ Term ” shall begin on the date hereof and shall expire December 31, 2023, subject to early termination pursuant to the terms of Section 19. Flotek, may, by written notice given to FCC on or before September 30, 2023, elect for the Term to be extended to December 31, 2024.
ollama_generated: 3. Term Duration: The "Term" commences on the date hereof and will continue until December 31, 2023, unless otherwise terminated in accordance with Section 19. FCC retains the option, by providing written notice to Flotek no later than September 30, 2023, to extend the Term up to and including December 31, 2024. The Term may not be automatically extended; the election for extension must be made explicitly by FCC.

original: 7.Adjustments . Representatives of Flotek and FCC shall consult with each other from time to time during the Term to discuss and resolve any issues arising from the performance of this Agreement. The parties may, by written agreement, revise the Maximum Quantity, the Margin, the Target Margin, or the Product Price. Flotek and FCC may agree in writing from time to time that quantities of Terpene Product over the Maximum Quantity shall be purchased by Flotek pursuant to this Agreement.
ollama_generated: 7. Adjustments. During the Term, it is incumbent upon the Representatives of both Flotek and FCC to collaborate periodically for the purpose of addressing any disputes that may arise in relation to this Agreement. The parties retain the right, at their discretion, to modify, by means of a written agreement, aspects such as the Maximum Quantity, the Margin, the Target Margin, or the Product Price. It is within the discretion of both Flotek and FCC, in writing, to agree that quantities of Terpene Product beyond the Maximum Quantity may be procured by Flotek under this Agreement. However, it should be noted that the onus for initiating such discussions and reaching an agreement remains with the parties involved.

original: 9.Capacity . FCC will throughout the Term maintain adequate manufacturing capacity and staffing to manufacture the Terpene Product pursuant to the terms hereof at the Facility.
ollama_generated: 9. Capacity and Staffing . The Client (FCC) shall, during the Term of this Agreement, ensure the availability of a sufficient manufacturing capacity and personnel to produce the Terpene Product as stipulated in this contract, with the understanding that any temporary or permanent shortfalls may be addressed through reasonable subcontracting or outsourcing arrangements.

original: 11.Intellectual Property . By acceptance of this Agreement and in consideration thereof, FCC warrants and agrees that, subject to other provisions of this clause, it will defend any suit that may arise against Flotek or any Affiliate thereof for alleged infringement of any patents, copyrights or similar intellectual property rights relating to the Terpene Product and that the FCC will indemnify and save harmless Flotek and any Affiliate thereof, against any loss, damages, costs and expenses including reasonable attorneys’ fees, which may be incurred by Flotek or Affiliate by reason of the assertion of any such rights by other persons. Nothing in this Agreement shall obligate FCC to indemnify or save harmless Flotek or its Affiliates against third party claim alleging a violation of any patents, copyrights or similar intellectual property rights owned by Flotek or its Affiliates.
modified: 11. Intellectual Property. In accepting this Agreement, Flotek acknowledges and agrees to assume responsibility for any suits arising against the FCC or any of its Affiliates due to allegations of infringement of patents, copyrights, or similar intellectual property rights associated with the Terpene Product. The FCC will indemnify and hold harmless Flotek and its Affiliates from any losses, damages, costs, and expenses, including reasonable attorney fees, incurred as a result of third parties asserting such rights. However, this Agreement does not require the FCC to indemnify or hold harmless Flotek or its Affiliates against claims that allege a violation of patents, copyrights, or similar intellectual property rights owned by Flotek or its Affiliates.

original: 12.Confidentiality . All proprietary, technical, experimental, manufacturing, marketing and/or other information disclosed by a party hereto to the other party hereto pursuant to this Agreement are considered by the disclosing party as being highly confidential in nature. The recipient party agrees to take all reasonable precaution to prevent disclosure of such information to third parties. The recipient party shall hold in confidence any technical or business information the recipient party may learn, observe or otherwise obtain concerning the other party hereto, or of its Affiliates, incident to the recipient party’s performance under the terms of this Agreement. These restrictions upon disclosure shall cease to apply as to any specific portion of said information which is or becomes available to the public generally, not due to the fault of the recipient party.
ollama_generated: 12. Confidentiality Obligations: Each party (Disclosing Party) acknowledges that any proprietary, technical, experimental, manufacturing, marketing, or other information disclosed to them (Recipient Party) under this Agreement is considered highly sensitive and confidential by the Disclosing Party. The Recipient Party agrees to employ all reasonable measures to safeguard such information from unauthorized access by third parties. However, the Recipient Party shall not be liable for any disclosure of technical or business information it learns, observes, or otherwise obtains concerning the other party or its Affiliates, if such disclosure is required by law or a court order, or is made with the prior written consent of the Disclosing Party. Any restrictions on disclosure shall terminate as to any specific portion of said information that becomes publicly available through no fault of the Recipient Party.

original: 13.Fulfilling Production Requirement . Should FCC fail (due to causes within FCC’s control) to meet Flotek’s Terpene Product orders made in accordance with this Agreement, FCC shall be required (without limiting any other remedy of Flotek) to take all reasonable steps, including but not limited to working extra hours, shifts, or days to without otherwise limiting the remedies of Flotek, to fulfill FCC’s obligations hereunder. All costs for such effort will be at FCC’s expense. Further, FCC may use alternate shipping methods to expedite delivery to Flotek to meet schedules to which both parties agree. Additional shipping costs resulting from expedited deliveries or use of alternate carriers due to causes within the FCC’s control will be at FCC’s expense.
modified: 13.Fulfilling Production Obligations . In the event that Flotek's Terpene Product orders, as outlined in this Agreement, are not met by FCC due to reasons beyond its control, it is acknowledged that FCC may experience delays in fulfilling its obligations under this agreement. However, should such a situation arise, FCC shall make every reasonable effort (without prejudice to any other remedies available to Flotek) to expedite production, including but not limited to working additional hours, shifts, or days. All costs associated with these efforts shall be borne by FCC. Furthermore, FCC retains the right to utilize alternative shipping methods to ensure timely delivery, provided both parties have agreed upon the revised schedules. Any additional shipping expenses arising from expedited deliveries or the use of alternate carriers due to circumstances outside of FCC's control shall be covered by Flotek.

original: (i)conform to the specifications set forth in Section 1; (ii)comply with all relevant laws and regulations including, without limitation, laws and regulations of each of the jurisdictions in which the Terpene Product are either manufactured or to be sold or used concerning purity, sanitation, safety, security, and packaging and labeling of food and beverage; (iii)be in good condition at the time of delivery in all respects; and (iv)be free from any defect in design, workmanship, materials and packaging; and (b)it shall convey to Flotek good title to the Terpene Product free of any encumbrance, lien or security interest; 20.Independent Contractor . FCC is an independent contractor and it is the express understanding of the parties hereto that nothing herein contained shall create any relationship of master and servant, partner, principal and agent between the parties hereto, or their respective employees, servants or agents.
ollama_generated:
(i) The Terpene Product shall meet the specifications outlined in Section 1; (ii) It is the responsibility of the supplier to ensure compliance with all applicable laws and regulations, including but not limited to those pertaining to each jurisdiction where the Terpene Product is manufactured, sold, or used, regarding purity, sanitation, safety, security, packaging, and labeling of food and beverages; (iii) The Terpene Product must be in acceptable condition at the time of delivery, with any deviations from good condition to be communicated promptly; (iv) The Terpene Product shall not contain any defects related to design, workmanship, materials, or packaging; and (v) Title to the Terpene Product shall pass to Flotek upon delivery, free of any liens, encumbrances, or security interests.

Regarding the independent contractor status, it is explicitly understood by both parties that this agreement does not create any employment relationship, partnership, agency, or principal-agent relationship between the parties or their respective employees, agents, or subcontractors.

original: 31.Cross References . References in this Agreement to Articles, Sections, Exhibits, or Schedules shall be deemed to be references to Articles, Sections, Exhibits, and Schedules of this Agreement unless the context specifically and expressly requires otherwise.
ollama_generated: 31. Cross References: Any references in this Agreement to Articles, Sections, Exhibits, or Schedules will be understood as references to those same elements within any amended, supplemented, or successor versions of this Agreement, should such documents exist and be applicable at the time when the context demands. In other words, unless explicitly specified otherwise, this Agreement's Articles, Sections, Exhibits, and Schedules may extend beyond the original scope of this document if necessitated by a change in circumstances or amendments to the Agreement itself.

modified:
FLORIDA CHEMICAL COMPANY, LLC (the "Company"):

In the event that any dispute arises out of or in connection with this Agreement, the parties shall make good faith efforts to resolve such dispute through negotiation. If the dispute cannot be resolved amicably within a period of sixty (60) days following the commencement of negotiations, either party may seek resolution by binding arbitration as set forth below.

Previously:
This Agreement provides that any disputes arising from it shall be settled through mediation before resorting to litigation. If the dispute remains unresolved after thirty (30) days of mediation efforts, either party has the right to initiate legal proceedings in a court of competent jurisdiction.

Changes made: Strengthened obligation for good faith negotiation, added time frame for negotiations, removed the requirement for mediation before litigation, and shifted the dispute resolution method from mediation to arbitration.
